channel.title: Run my server on Ubuntu
channel.description:
Hi Moparians,
I have a really tricky problem. I bought a VPS yesterday and installed Ubuntu on it. I'm new to Linux, but I understand some of the things :D Well my problem is: how do I run my server on Ubuntu?
I followed this tutorial (I am using the tutorial with server.class (main class, I suppose XD) in another directory: Server (all directories are in this one, run.sh is here!) - bin - server - sever.class):
http://www.rune-server.org/general-discussion/hosting/190359-how-host-server-linux-debian.html
My run.sh:
#!/bin/bash java -cp bin.server
If I open terminal on my graphic ubuntu (I have installed everything possible lol) I get this error (it is one of the many lines XD): Usage: java [-options] class [args...] (to execute a class) or java [-option] -jar jarfile [args...] (to execute a jar file) where options include: -d32 use a 32-bit data model if available
And so on....
Could someone help me?
Thank you!
Sincerely,
Frank

item.title: Run my server on Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @cdfles cdfles
item.description:
@cdfles wrote:

Thank you, I will try that.
So: I have to install Java6 and then install Java Openjdk-7-jre and -jdk?

Will post when it is done, or I’ll post any other problems

Update: Still got some errors

359xnxd.png708×160

Hmm…

Read full topic

item.title: Run my server on Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

The second one means that you’re running compiled source code that was compiled with a newer Java version, Java 6 and Java 7 aren’t backwards compatible. Make sure you have the newest available Java installed, I believe most repos are quite updated with Java and should have Java 7, you may be behind a minor version but as long as you have Java 7 you should be fine.

Read full topic

item.title: Run my server on Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @cdfles cdfles
item.description:
@cdfles wrote:

HcoJustin:

You can’t use ; for path separators … Replace them all with :

I’m going to try Will post the outcome of it here

Did not work for me.

Made 2 pics:

  • Pic error with this code: #!/bin/sh java -Xmx800m -cp bin;deps/poi.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar;deps/jython.jar;log4j-1.2.15.jar; server.Server

ezgb51.png716×1027

  • Pic error with new code: #!/bin/sh java -Xmx800m -cp bin:deps/poi.jar:deps/mysql.jar:deps/mina.jar:deps/slf4j.jar:deps/slf4j-nop.jar:deps/jython.jar:log4j-1.2.15.jar: server.Server

fumj2u.png724×363

Read full topic

item.title: Run my server on Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @cdfles cdfles
item.description:
@cdfles wrote:

Okay, well got Ubuntu installed now. Same problem lol, installed openjdk-6-jre and openjdk-6-jdk via terminal
Same problem, my run.sh is:

#!/bin/sh java -Xmx800m -cp bin;deps/poi.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar;deps/jython.jar;log4j-1.2.15.jar; server.Server
Using PI base. Same error. What do I need to do now? BTW rights are max.

I’m a noob in Linux, so could anyone take me through it step-by-step? Would really appreciate it =)

ADDITION:
run.sh 2: deps/poi.jar: Permission denied
run.sh 2: log4j.1.2.15.jar: not found
run.sh 2: server.server: not found

Copied a little bit op the new error above.

Read full topic

item.title: Run my server on Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

Shouldn’t it be bin\server?

If not, try running it directly in the console, to see if the issue is your script.

Read full topic

item.title: Run my server on Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @cdfles cdfles
item.description:
@cdfles wrote:

tyb97:

I’ve ran a few servers and fixed up a few clients to work with Ubuntu, what’s wrong with it?

Hi, well if i try to run run.sh, it results in this:

Usage: java [-options] class [args…]
(to execute a class)
or java [-option] -jar jarfile [args…]
(to execute a jar file)
where options include:
-d32 use a 32-bit data model if available

That is the problem, it should run my server isn’t it?

Read full topic
